name: StepIndicator
description: The StepIndicator (progress indicator) is a visual representation of a users progress through a set of steps or series of actions.

props.name: mode
props.doc: Defines how the StepIndicator should work. Use `static` for non-interactive steps. Use `strict` for a chronological step order, also, the user can navigate between visited steps. Use `loose` if the user should be able to navigate freely.

props.name: data
props.doc: Defines the data/steps showing up in a JavaScript Array or JSON format like `[{title,is_current}]`. See below for properties of `STEP_DATA`.

props.name: current_step
props.doc: Defines the initial step starting from 0. Also defines the furthest step visited when `mode="strict"`. Will update to the new step if changed (but will not trigger the `on_change` event). Defaults to `0`.

props.name: overview_title
props.doc: The title shown inside the `<StepIndicatorModal />` supplemental screen reader text for the `<StepIndicatorTriggerButton />`. Defaults to `Steps Overview`.

props.name: step_title
props.doc: Label for `<StepIndicatorTriggerButton />` and screen reader text for `<StepIndicatorItem />`. Must contain `%step` and `%count` to interpolate `current_step` and `stepCount` into the text. Defaults to `Step %step of %count`.

props.name: hide_numbers
props.doc: Define whether to show automatically counted numbers or not. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: no_animation
props.doc: If set to `true`, the height animation on step change and list expansion will be omitted. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: expandedInitially
props.doc: Set to `true` to have the list be expanded initially. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: outset
props.doc: Whether or not to break out (using negative margins) on larger screens. Defaults to `false`. Same as `outset` in [Card](/uilib/components/card/properties).

props.name: status
props.doc: Is used to set the status text.

props.name: status_state
props.doc: In case the status state should be `info` or `error`. Defaults to `warn`.

props.name: skeleton
props.doc: If set to `true`, an overlaying skeleton with animation will be shown.

props.name: sidebar_id
props.doc: A unique string-based ID in order to bind together the main component and the sidebar (`<StepIndicator.Sidebar />`). Both have to get the same ID.

props.name: step_title_extended
props.doc: Descriptive label for `<StepIndicatorModal />`. Must contain `%step` and `%count` to interpolate `current_step` and `stepCount` into the text. Defaults to `You are on step %step of %count`.

props.name: on_item_render
props.doc: Deprecated, just use step item `title`. Callback function whose return is rendered inside each step instead of the default render. Has to return a React Node. Receives parameter `{ StepItem, element, attributes, props, context }`, where `props` also includes all props from the step object (like `title` or `status`) and the `<StepItem>` is a component that can be used to wrap your returned content.

props.name: title
props.doc: The title of the step.

props.name: is_current
props.doc: If set to `true`, this item step will be set as the current selected step. This can be used instead of `current_step` on the main component.

props.name: inactive
props.doc: If set to `true`, this item step will be handled as an inactive step and will not be clickable. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: disabled
props.doc: If set to `true`, this step will be handled the same as `inactive` as well as getting a disabled mouseover and `aria-disabled="true`. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: on_render
props.doc:
Deprecated, just use `title`. Callback function whose return is rendered inside the step instead of the default render (or `on_item_render`). Has to return a React Node.
Receives parameter `{ StepItem, element, attributes, props, context }`, where `props` also includes all props in the step object (like `title` or `status`) and the `` is a component that can be used to wrap your returned content.

events.name: on_click
events.doc: Called when user clicks the step. Is called right before the main component's `on_click`. Receives parameter `{ event, item, current_step, currentStep }`

events.name: on_change
events.doc: Will be called when the user changes step by clicking in the steps list (changing the `current_step` prop does not trigger the event). Receives parameter `{ event, item, current_step, currentStep }`.
